strings.Value: "The Six Bears? Of course I remember!"
"Those scumbags who exiled you?"
"I thought you're in my tribe now."
[Nod without a word]
"Do you want me to chase them off?"
"That's odd. We're a long way from the Realm of the Mammoth Lords!"
"What are they doing here?"
"Are you sure it's them?"
{n}The barbarian sips the beer from her mug with a grim look. She hesitates, as if she doesn't know where to begin.{/n} "Once I told you about my tribe. Remember?"
"Me — I'd be happy to forget. But…"
"That's them. I thought I'd never see them again — and thank {g|Gorum}Gorum{/g} for that. But hell no!"
"Of course! I left them and I don't regret it! But here's the shitty part…"
{n}She sips some more beer and clears her throat nervously, and then Amiri continues.{/n}
"They were spotted on your lands. Our scouts told they saw their camp near the {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} border."
"You're asking me? I don't have no idea!"
"Exactly. Leaving homeland and heading off south, where strangers live — the tribes have never done this!"
"What? Haha, It would be really nice to kick their asses… But now let's get serious."

"First, I also thought our scouts were mistaken. You southerners can't tell one tribe and another. So I talked the scout really long — asked him about the tattoos, the amulets, the looks of the camp... It's them. It's really them. I know."

"I really hoped I'd never see these ugly faces again. I walked across {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} to be as far from them as I could! And now they follow me. What the hell?! So... Let's visit my old tribe. Find out what do they want so far from their snow. And then we can kick them back!"
{n}She finishes her beer in one gulp, then belches and stumbles towards the tavern maid to order another.{/n}
